content: The "Congenital Heart Futures Reauthorization Act of 2017" amends the Public Health Service Act to enhance research, data collection, and public awareness of congenital heart disease. The Secretary is required to conduct activities to improve education related to congenital heart disease and award grants for related initiatives. The Secretary will award grants for activities to improve understanding of congenital heart disease epidemiology, including incidence, risk factors, natural history, health care utilization, and demographic factors. The Secretary may conduct awareness and educational activities regarding congenital heart disease, including collecting data on health outcomes and considering health disparities among individuals with the disease. The Secretary conducts awareness and educational activities on congenital heart disease, collecting data on health outcomes and disparities. Information is made public, ensuring patient privacy and eligibility for grants. The Congenital Heart Futures Reauthorization Act of 2017 requires specialized nonprofit entities to apply for funding and authorizes $10,000,000 annually from 2020 to 2024. The Secretary must report on activities related to congenital heart disease to relevant congressional committees within 3 years of enactment. The Public Health Service Act, as amended by section 2, requires a summary of research findings and ongoing efforts within the Department of Health and Human Services on congenital heart disease in patients of all ages.
